snippet: When Beth Dary and Sarah Lutz began their collaborative installation, natural disasters and the need for barnaclelike tenacity weren’t on their minds as much as the threat of rising water levels.
abstract: Exhibit Interplay: A Collaborative Residency, is on display at Miranda Arts Project Space in Port Chester, NY; original project by artists Beth Dary and Sarah Lutz has been expanded to explore the effects of Hurricane Sandy on nearby Byram River (Metropolitan/Westchester).
lead_paragraph: When Beth Dary and Sarah Lutz began their collaborative installation, natural disasters and the need for barnaclelike tenacity weren’t on their minds as much as the threat of rising water levels.

headline.seo: ‘Interplay: A Collaborative Residency,’ at Miranda Arts Project Space in Port Chester
headline.main: After the Storm, Rethinking a Riverscape
headline.print_headline: After the Storm, Rethinking a Riverscape

keywords.value: Miranda Arts Project Space (Port Chester, NY)
